text:
8th Street, north side, from and including Sixth Ave., to but not including Seventh Ave. The view shown is Public School No. 39.

July 4, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

339 8th Street, adjoining the northwest corner of Sixth Avenue, showing the Young Men's Hebrew Association. View 2 shows the place boarded.

P. L. Sperr        View 1: July 4th, 1936
   View 2: May 3rd, 1941

339 8th Street, adjoining the northwest corner of Sixth Avenue, showing the Young Men's Hebrew Association. View 2 shows the place boarded.

P. L. Sperr        View 1: July 4th, 1936
   View 2: May 3rd, 1941

Peddlers, Flowers: A huckster selling flowers and shrubs on Sixth Ave., at West 8th Street. This is a set of 2 views of the same individual. Note the tower of the Municipal and Magistrates Courts.

April 25, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Flowers - [Brooklyn].
